title: Update fee destination address

### Notes

### Tests

The `mintV1` test is updated accordingly.

title: MET-126: Added new option: CollectionDetails::V2
body: Although the new `CollectionDetails` variant has been added with no additional logic on top, the changes happen to be relatively big. I'd rather completely remove the `V1` option with its related methods (or even whole files like `bubblegum_set_collection_size`), however, I'm worried that would destroy backward compatibility.

title: Adding an extra account to act as a signing authority instead of the …
body: …payer.

title: Allow 0.8.2 to < 1.0.0 Umi versions

title: Move trait implementation to correct location for Rust client
body: Very minor cleanup after I realize its in the wrong file

title: Update Rust version for Rust client crate publish CI
body: Needed because publishing the crate does a build and pulls Solana 1.18 which requires Rust 1.72.0 or newer.

title: Use `DelegateScenario` to combine Metadata and Holder delegate functionality
body:
### Idea 
* See comment in https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/mpl-token-metadata/pull/84
* We could make use of the `DelegateScenario` enum to parameterize and thus combine `create_metadata_delegate_v1` and `create_holder_delegate_v1`, and then simplify the optional `role` arguments for `create_pda_account` into one.
* Similarly we could combine `revoke_metadata_delegate_v1` and `revoke_holder_delegate_v1`, as well as `close_metadata_delegate_record` and `close_holder_delegate_record`.
* The `revoke` changes refactor a bit to avoid some logic duplication.

title: Add deprecated MasterEditionV1 to clients
Add Token 2022 mint test
body: This PR adds a test to mint a `pNFT` using Token 2022 to show how the associated token account should be derived since the current default value only supports SPL Token program.

title: MIP-7: Add a print delegate
body:
This PR was made to address [MIP-7](https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/mip/blob/0983ac4e3ee6b517755ca6bc5db21784f42e76d7/mip-7.md), adding escrowless edition printing through a delegate.

This PR consists of two parts, adding a holder delegate and adding the additional delegate account to print.

* Holder Delegate - The holder delegate is a new, third type of delegate added for NFTs and pNFTs. It's allows for the holder to delegate permissions that specific to them. Currently the only Delegate Role is for Prints but it could easily be extended to other uses.

* Print Delegate Role - This delegate role allows for a delegated authority to print an edition, rather than just the holder. Multiple delegates can be set so an edition can be escrowlessly listed on several marketplaces at one. Because the unified Instruction architecture versions on args structs rather than the accounts context, I hacked the delegate in as a remaining account instead of created a new Instruction with duplicate handling. It switches based on the accounts array length to pass in an Option for the holder delegate role.

title: Add pda prefix values
body: This PR updates Kinobi version to generate PDA prefix values on the Rust client.

title: Update token auth rules types
body: This PR updates the types copied from Token Auth Rules, since they are currently out of sync. These types are exported to both JS and Rust clients.

title: Revert to optional token owner on mint
body: This PR reverts to optional token owner on mint to avoid a breaking change.

title: Fixing description of the collect IX arg.
Fix shank annotation
body: This PR fixes the shank annotation on `BubblegumSetCollectionSize` instruction so the Rust client is correctly generated.

title: Add safe deserialize impl
body: This PR adds a macro to autogenerate `safe_deserialize` impl to types on the Rust client.

title: Fix typos
body: Fix typos

title: Add client helper for ProgrammableNonFungible master editions
body: This PR adds an `assert_edition_is_programmable` helper to determine if the master edition is a `ProgrammableNonFungible` or not. It also includes a fix on a Shank annotation – this does not require changes to the program.

title: Render parent instructions in Rust client
body: This PR enables the rendering of parent instructions in the Rust client.

title: Add nft.storage token, update packages
body:
mpl-essentials was renamed to mpl-toolbox

nft.storage nowadays requires a storeage token. This adds an easy way to add it.

title: Set update authority as optional signer
body: PR to set the `update_authority` as an optional signer on the `CreateMetadataAccountV3` instruction.

title: Add default impl to types
body: This PR adds `Default` trait implementation for generated types. It also add `impl` blocks for `MasterEdition`, `Metadata` and `TokenRecord` with deserialization helpers.

title: Downgrade mpl-utils dependency
body: This PR downgrades `mpl-utils` version from the `0.3.x` to `0.2.x`, since Token Metadata `1.13.x` does not depend on `spl-token-2022`.

title: feat: fetch all NFTs ( with tokenStandard)  by collection address
body: Created new function `fetchAllDigitalAssetByVerifiedCollection`  which will run several gpa calls to try and fetch all the NFTs by their verified collection. This method only works on newer collections that have their tokenStandard set.

title: Bump kinobi version
body: PR bumps Kinobi to `0.15.1`, which includes improvements for using CPI builders on Anchor programs.

title: Cache Rust client dependencies
body:
- Use the `cache-crate` action on the Rust client when building and testing
- Rename the `cache-programs` action to `cache-crates` (same functionality)

title: Don't autogenerate clients on CI, fail instead
body: Otherwise CI fails for all external forks

title: Update Kinobi version for Rust client
body:
This PR bumps Kinobi version to `0.15`, which includes new features for the Rust client:
- Add a `serde` feature
- Change mod visibility to avoid ambiguity when importing types
- Add bytes helper to account types
- Add doc to default accounts

title: Only unwrap the metadata.data link
body: This avoid nested structs to be generated as "UpdateV1InstructionDataData"

title: Update Kinobi to 0.14
body:
- Bump Kinobi version, regenerate clients and adjust custom resolvers
- Bump mpl-toolbox version on JS client
- Bring over changes from #45 for the Rust client

title: Prevent delegate to change the update authority
body: Currently, an `AsAuthorityItemDelegateV2` delegate can change the update authority. This is an undesirable behaviour since a rogue delegate can take over the authority of the metadata. This PR deprecates the `new_update_authority` field and prevents the delegate from changing the update authority.

title: Remove unused submodules
body: There seems to be some "leftovers" from the submodules config, this PR removes them.

title: Update kinobi version
body: PR that updates the Kinobi version, which simplifies the dependencies for the generated Rust client.

title: Add rust client sdk
body: This PR adds a Rust client SDK with minimal dependency requirements. More details of how to use the SDK are presented on the `README.md` file.

title: Configure Kinobi for PrintV1 and fix some program errors
body:
This PR configures Kinobi for the `printV1` instruction in order to provide default values for arguments and accounts. It also adds a bunch of tests that print a new edition by both initialising the mint/token accounts beforehand and letting the program initialise them for us.

Additionally, we identified some issues on the program for the latter which @febo fixed in this PR. Namely, the following issues were fixed:
- Using the `edition_mint_authority` instead of the `edition_account` as the mint authority when initializing a mint account
- Minting 1 token to the `edition_token_account` after initializing an empty ATA account

title: Add Solana version range
body: This PR adds Solana `1.16` compatibility for Token Metadata. As a result, Solana dependencies are expressed with a version range `>= 1.14.13, < 1.17`.

title: fix: broken link in pNFT guide
body: Update broken links, to point to this ☝️ repository [Programmable NFT Guide](https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/mpl-token-metadata/blob/main/programs/token-metadata/program/ProgrammableNFTGuide.md)

title: Allow replacing a delegate
body: This PR changes the behaviour of the `Delegate` instruction to have the same behaviour as SPL Token `approve` instruction: to set a new delegate, there is no need to revoke the previous one.

title: Deprecate locked transfer address
body: PR to deprecate the address in the `LockedTransfer` delegate. This allows the delegate to transfer to any address. The `address` field is still present on the delegate args to maintain compatibility, but it will be removed in a future release.

title: program: Update serialization to `borsh::to_writer`
body:
#### Problem

The token-metadata program uses the `serialize` function directly from Borsh, which has the unfortunate side-effect of consuming the underlying slice.

More information about the issue at https://github.com/near/borsh-rs/pull/34

#### Solution

Use the `borsh::to_writer` API which properly moves the `Writer` in order to serialize the data.  You can see how this was done in SPL at https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-program-library/pull/4228.

This will avoid any gotchas already present in the code. In `programs/token-metadata/program/src/state/mod.rs`, there's this comment:

```
// passes a slice to borsh so the internal account data array does not get
// temporarily resized
```

Using the `borsh::to_writer` API, you never need to worry about that!

title: Add Token-2022 support
body:
PR to add support to Token-2022 accounts in the unified handlers. The changes consist of:
- using `StateWithExtensions` to unpack SPL Token `Account` and `Mint`
- all SPL Token instructions used are from `spl-token-2022`, which support both SPL Token versions
- use of `test_case` on bpf tests so tests run using both SPL Token versions

All unified instructions are updated:

 - [x] Burn
 - [x] Create
 - [x] Delegate
 - [x] Lock
 - [x] Mint
 - [x] Print
 - [x] Revoke
 - [x] Transfer
 - [x] Unlock
 - [x] Unverify
 - [x] Update
 - [x] Verify

These now can be used with both SPL Token programs.

The changes depend on the following PRs:
- mpl-utils: https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/metaplex-program-library/pull/1151
- rooster (for bpf tests): https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/rooster/pull/7

Additionally, validation of mint and token accounts extensions were added to the `Create`, `Mint`, `Print` and `Transfer` instructions.

Co-authored-by: Jon Cinque <me@jonc.dev> (@joncinque)
